b: ^ so i don't eat all of the rabbits lunchtime food

RupertWants: ^Please will you help me get some munchings?

s: ^Yes yes yes, let's get on with it.
^I swear, good pig, that I am devoted to this quest.

Rules: ^You win this game by making sure the piglet gets something crunchy to munch upon.

s: ^Can we... just... get on with it please

c-0: ^Rupert. I understand. You have a hunger.
^Rupert. I understand. You have a deep, terrible hunger.
^Rupert. I understand. You have a deep, terrible hunger, a hunger that must be satisfied.
^Rupert. I understand. You have a deep, terrible hunger, a hunger that can be sated only in the hot fires of shame that roar in the aftermath of indulgence
^Rupert. I understand. You have a deep, terrible hunger, a hunger that can be sated only in the hot fires of shame that roar in the aftermath of indulgence; the warm glow that follows a biscuit.

^Rupert. I understand. You have a deep, terrible hunger, a hunger that can be sated only in the hot fires of shame that roar in the aftermath of indulgence; the salty luminescence that comes only from attending to the golden cracker's siren call.

BigBoots: ^OH SO WE FINK WE'RE TOO GOOD FOR A PICTURE OF PIGGITS, DO WE?

g-2: ^FINE YOU WON'T GET NO MORE PIGGIT PICCIES.

s: ^Look, Rupert, I'd really like to help you get that cracker
^If you make me look at piglet pictures again, I might lose my shit."

Playthrough_4: ^I'm afraid that's all the playthroughs that I've coded so far. I didn't anticipate anyone needing more than three attempts in a game about a piglet trying to get a ritz cracker from underneath a coffee table, so... I don't know what to tell you.

c-0: ^: there's a couple of things that might not make sense.
^, there's three distinct voices in the game.
^1. You, the player, who will give instructions to Rupert etc etc
^2. The neutral game voice, which does things like explain the rules to you and tell you how you did

s: ^These are all going to be different colours and sizes

g-1: ^It'll mostly be clear, but the thing that MIGHT be confusing is that sometimes you'll be clicking choices as yourself, and sometimes as Rupert.

c-2: ^, mostly in making it clear when you are in control of which character.

s: ^He tried to look like he was paying attention whilst really looking for a cracker.

g-6: ^He held her gaze with one eye, while the other skilfully scanned from sky to skirting board.
^It was time; he slyly moved over towards the coffee table, certain it was the only remaining place that might hide a morsel of crumbly crunchy nice.
^He looked inwards. The true cracker is the one in the heart of the hungry.
^He checked if the cracker was under the table like he thought it was.
^ make, so light was his tread.

g-6: ^That cracker was knocking about, so he slyly scanned the room.
^It was immensely important to obtain the crunchable delight very quietly and calmly.

Result_100: ^How very lazy, not even spotting the cracker that was there for the munchings.
^With behaviour like this, you'll never be the plumpest hog in the trough.
Result_110: ^That is twice in a row that you have not seen the cracker lying on the floor.
Result_111: ^Look, here's the thing. I'm not even certain it's possible to see this ending. To see this, you need to have...

g-1: ^And this is in a game where some of the bad choices disappear once you've picked them.

c-1: ^, in some ways this is an achievement.

g-1: ^I don't want you to feel bad, but by this point in the game you could be seeing one of twenty-one different endings.

s: ^Do you know where this one ranks?

g-2: ^Twentieth. This could only have been worse if you didn't even see the cracker this time.

Result_113: ^Okay, so we appear to have chiselled a crack into the boulder that is your brain.

c-0: ^, with supreme effort, that this next attempt will see you overcome the greatest test.

g-1: ^I refer, of course, to popping the dastardly biccie into your gob.

Result_120: ^You spotted the cracker this time, but did not snag it with your grabby trots.
Result_121: ^Well, I'm not really certain how to help.
^Pick up the cracker, please. Pick. It up.
Result_122: ^It's a little early to rest on your laurels and revisit past glories.

s: ^I know we're very proud that we managed to see the cracker on the second attempt

c-0: ^, but repeating that achievement is, perhaps, a trifle unambitious.

Result_123: ^This might help motivate you; you're progressing as slowly as is possible, other than not making progress at all.
^Maybe we could... get a bit of a trot on?
Result_130: ^You held the cracker this time, but you did not munch it.
Result_131: ^No, don't get disheartened! The appropriate response to hardship is to go harder! Pick up the cracker WITH YOUR FACE!
Result_132: ^Well. What a pickle we find ourselves in. You didn't pick it up this time. Sigh.
Result_133: ^No. You see, you've gotten complacent. You can't just repeatedly hold the cracker, you have to eat it.
^You know, eating. It's like holding it with your mouth?
Result_200: ^You did not even hold that lovely cracker that you saw between your trotters, let alone munch it.
Result_210: ^Last time, you at least saw the cracker.
Result_211: ^The cracker's under the table. Just in case you've forgotten.
Result_212: ^You now have a firm grasp of where the cracker is, but not yet a firm grasp of the cracker.
Result_220: ^The cracker isn't going to hurt you. Don't just look at it! Get it! Munch it!
Result_223: ^WE'RE NEARLY THERE. YOU HELD THE CRACKER.
Result_230: ^You have now actually held that lovely cracker in your worthy trots.
^From the grabby trot to the munchy face.
Result_231: ^I said "one last final push", not "just sit around, scratch your botty and toot a bit"!
Result_232: ^After an initial failure, you managed to hold a cracker... and now, you've gone back to not holding a cracker.
Result_233: ^After an inauspicious start, you've now managed the very difficult task of holding a savoury snack twice.
^I think that, if you try really hard, you can get it from the trotter to the mouth.
Result_300: ^You had a cracker but you did not munch it.
Result_310: ^Did you forget how to pick things up?
Result_311: ^You're still not picking it up! Don't let the big bad cracker scare you!
Result_312: ^You saw the cracker again. I think that you can eat it, if you really try very hard.
Result_313: ^Right, you're back on it. You picked it up in your trotters again. Well done!
Result_320: ^You went from holding a cracker (but not eating it) to struggling with the very concept of holding a cracker.
Result_321: ^It just gets worse and worse every time. It's very sad.
Result_322: ^You had a strong start, followed by a persistent decline. You're New Labour.
Result_323: ^Well, we're back on track, we've managed to hold the cracker again.
^Good for you. Now... this time, eat it please.
Result_330: ^Did I mention that you need to eat the cracker?
Result_332: ^Well you're not even trying now, are you?
^Or are you so demoralised by failing to eat a cracker, twice, that now you can't even bring yourself to hold it?
Result_333: ^I... I don't know how to help you.
^You've literally had a cracker in your trotter three times.
^Why aren't you eating it? It's the whole point of the...
